title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી વખાણું વડોદરે, હરિજન મનનું હેત<RHYME_208186>; 
ભાવે ભક્તિ ભલી કરે, સોંપી તન મન ધન સમેત<RHYME_208186>.
gujarati.context: In Vadodara, one should remember the lowly caste; through devotion, one's heart and wealth become equalized.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જોયે ન મળે જક્તમાં, એહ જેવાં જન એક<RHYME_208188>; 
પ્રીત્ય જેની પ્રકટ પ્રભુમાં, ગ્રહી ન મૂકે ટેક<RHYME_208188>.
gujarati.context: Those who are unable to find their soulmate in this life will meet again; the beloved's true form is revealed only before God.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવાં જન અનેક છે, જેનાં પૂર્યાં હરિએ લાડ<RHYME_208189>; 
તેની કીર્તિ લખવા, મારા ચિત્તમાં ઘણી ચાડ<RHYME_208189>.
gujarati.context: There are many people who have pleased God with their good deeds; I will write down his virtues, but my mind is filled with much chaos.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
બ્રાહ્મણ નાગરી નાત્યમાં, એક મોંઘીબાઈ હરિજન<RHYME_208191>; 
અચળમતિ મહારાજમાં, કરે ભાવે સહિત ભજન<RHYME_208191>.
gujarati.context: In Brahmin society, there is a noble Harjani woman; she devotes herself to worship with great devotion and enthusiasm.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ભજે ભાવે ભરી ભગવાન<RHYME_208192>, સમજે હરિને સામર્થિવાન<RHYME_208192>; 
થાય સમાધિ દેખે શ્રીહરિ, અતિ સુખી રહે સુખે કરી.
gujarati.context: One's love for God should be filled with devotion and understanding, which leads to a state of blissful calmness. In this state, one can see Lord Shri Hari and experience eternal joy.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એક દિવસે ધારણા માંઇ<RHYME_208193>, ગઈ હતા હરિ પોત્યે ત્યાંઇ<RHYME_208193>; 
કર્યું દર્શન દયાળુ તણું, તેણે આવ્યું છે આનંદ ઘણું.
gujarati.context: One day, God's presence was felt there; now, abundant joy has arrived.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
પછી મોંઘીબાઈ કહે મહારાજ<RHYME_208195>, તમે નાથ છો રાજાધિરાજ<RHYME_208195>; 
સર્વે અવતાર તમે જ ધર્યા, જુગોજુગમાં જન ઉધાર્યા.
gujarati.context: "You are a king without an empire, Maharaja; the entire universe was won by you, and humanity was reclaimed in every corner."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કેવો લીધો કૃષ્ણ અવતાર<RHYME_208197>, કેવાં ધાર્યાંતાં આયુધ ચાર<RHYME_208197>; 
વળી અષ્ટ પટરાણી જેહ<RHYME_208198>, જેના સુત સુભગ છે તેહ<RHYME_208198>.
gujarati.context: Krishna's avatar is one that has been obtained through devotion and duty, with the sword of righteousness in hand. He who is guided by such a righteous path will have a life filled with good fortune.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એહ સહિત ઇચ્છું દર્શન<RHYME_208199>, દિયો હે પ્રભુ થઈ પ્રસન્ન<RHYME_208199>; 
પછી હસી બોલ્યા હરિરાય<RHYME_208200>, જોઈ જનમન અભિપ્રાય<RHYME_208200>.
gujarati.context: I wish to see You, Lord, and become pleased; afterwards, I'll laugh and say "Oh Hari" with a happy soul.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધર્યું કૃષ્ણરૂપ સુખખાણી, સંગે શોભે અષ્ટ પટરાણી; 
શંખ ચક્ર ગદા પદ્મ ધરી, શોભે સુત સહિત શ્રીહરિ.
gujarati.context: Krishna's form brings joy and beauty, accompanied by eight-fold celestial music. The Lord, with his conch shell, discus, lotus flower, and all, appears resplendent with His consort Lakshmi.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવાં દીધાં આવીને દર્શન<RHYME_208199>, જોઈ જન થયા છે મગન<RHYME_208199>; 
દઈ દર્શન પધાર્યા નાથ<RHYME_208202>, નીર્ખી ચકિત થયો સૌ સાથ<RHYME_208202>.
gujarati.context:
After seeing the world's beauty, one becomes wise; 
If you don't see it, wisdom will be wasted on all together.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે આશ્ચર્ય વાત આ તો, થયો પરચો કહ્યો નથી જાતો; 
વળી એક બીજી એની વાત<RHYME_208204>, સહુ સાંભળજ્યો તે સાક્ષાત<RHYME_208204>.
gujarati.context: This couplet says that the current situation is astonishing, something that has happened without any warning or prior indication. It advises to listen carefully and pay attention to the matter at hand.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કર્યો મહારાજને કાજે થાળ<RHYME_208205>, આવી જમિયા દીનદયાળ<RHYME_208205>; 
જમ્યા પેંડા પતાસાં ને પાક<RHYME_208206>, વડાં ભજિયાં સુંદર શાક<RHYME_208206>.
gujarati.context: The king has done his duty with dedication and diligence, bringing prosperity to the people; just as plants grow lush and beautiful under a wise farmer's care.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જમી અર્ધ વડું આપ્યું નાથે, લીધું મોંઘીબાએ હાથોહાથે; 
આપી પ્રસાદી વેંચીને તેની, વળી વાત કહું બીજી એની.
gujarati.context: Life is fleeting and hard to grasp, but we'll enjoy the moments given with all our might. I'll tell you another story, sharing the blessings received.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
બીજે દિવસે બદ્રિનાં ફળ<RHYME_208209>, જેનાં ઝીણાં બીજ જાડાં દળ<RHYME_208209>; 
તે આપ્યાં છે પોશ ભરી પોત્યે, એવાં બીજાં મળે નહિ ગોત્યે.
gujarati.context: The fruit of today's effort will be sweet, just like the seeds that are sown with patience and care; such seeds do not sprout quickly, but yield a bountiful harvest in due time.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ પર્ચા અપરમપાર<RHYME_208211>, આપે વાલોજી વારમવાર<RHYME_208211>; 
હરિજનમાં મોટેરાં મુખી, અતિ અલૌકિ સુખમાં સુખી.
gujarati.context: This couplet describes the joy and happiness that comes from embracing one's true nature, with no pretenses or expectations. It celebrates finding peace and contentment in one's own community, free from societal pressures.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેને ઘેર બાઇઓ હરિજન<RHYME_208191>, નિત્યે સુણે કથા કીરતન<RHYME_208191>; 
બેસે સભા બાઇઓની મંડળી, કરે વાત પ્રકટની વળી.
gujarati.context: The poor and marginalized are gathered around God every day, listening to the stories of devotion. The assembly of women gathers together, sharing tales of their spiritual journey with great enthusiasm.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
હૈયે પ્રીત્ય હરિ માંહિ ઘણી, શું કહીએ મોટ્યપ બાયો તણી; 
તેને એક દિવસ મોઝાર<RHYME_208215>, થઈ પુષ્પની વૃષ્ટિ અપાર<RHYME_208215>.
gujarati.context: In a state of great love for God, what shall we say to those who are skeptical; one day, like a gentle rain shower, the petals of wisdom will be bestowed upon us.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે સતસંગી કુસંગી મળી, સૌએ વીણી લીધાં તેહ વળી; 
એમ થયું દિન દોય ચાર<RHYME_208197>, એહાદિ નહિ પર્ચાનો પાર<RHYME_208197>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

When friends become enemies and everyone is filled with jealousy, then even a day becomes fourfold; it's as if there's no one to cross over.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવા પરચા થાય અનંત<RHYME_208216>, કહેતાં લખતાં ન આવે અંત<RHYME_208216>; 
વળી એક કહું બીજી વાત<RHYME_208216>, સામર્થિ શ્રીહરિની સાક્ષાત<RHYME_208216>.
gujarati.context: The impermanence of worldly pursuits is endless, and there's no end to the story being written; I'll speak about something else, taking shelter in the divine wisdom of Srihari.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એક અંબાબાઈ છે દક્ષણી, કરે ભક્તિ પ્રભુજીની ઘણી; 
તેના દેહનો આવિયો અંત<RHYME_208216>, આવ્યા તેડવા શ્રીભગવંત<RHYME_208216>.
gujarati.context:
A devout soul from South India is abundant in devotion; 
At the end of their mortal life, they are taken to Sri Bhagavant.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
લાવ્યા વિમાન તે લાખો લેખે, ચાલ્યા તેડી જન સહુ દેખે; 
સતસંગી કુસંગી સહુને, થયાં દર્શન જન બહુને.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that when you leave someone, it takes a vast distance to forget them, but when you're together, even a moment's glance is enough. Satsangis (spiritual friends) and kinsfolk are rare to find, but they bring immense joy in our lives.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ત્યાર પછી એહ અંબાબાઈ<RHYME_208218>, દીઠાં જને તે સમાધિ માંઇ<RHYME_208193>; 
તે સાથે એમ મોકલ્યું કઈ<RHYME_208218>, એક એંધાણી સુંદર દઈ<RHYME_208218>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the couplet in English:

It's not just anyone who gets to sit in Samadhi, but with effort and practice, one can reach that state.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
શ્યામ સાડી પટારામાં મેલી, તે છે બીજી બાઈને આપેલી; 
એ વાત સર્વે સાચી જો થાય<RHYME_208220>, તો તમે સંશે કરશો માં કાંય<RHYME_208220>.
gujarati.context: Shyam's proposal was accepted in the middle of nowhere, and he gave it to someone else as a gift; if this story is true for everyone, then you will find your own haven somewhere.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે કહ્યું આવી સમાધિવાને, માન્યું સત્ય સુણી સર્વે કાને; 
જે જે વાત મોકલીતી કઈ<RHYME_208218>, તે તે સરવે સાચી જ થઈ<RHYME_208218>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

"When I have spoken, listen with an open mind; what I say is true and will become reality."
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જોઈ આશ્ચર્ય પામિયાં જન, સહુ કહેવા લાગ્યાં ધન્ય ધન્ય; 
વળી વાત અનુપમ એક<RHYME_208188>, કહું સામર્થિ હરિની વિશેક<RHYME_208188>.
gujarati.context: When I saw such wonderful people, it seemed like a miracle; they were so blessed, so blessed.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એક હરિજન દ્વિજ માંઇ<RHYME_208193>, તેનું નામ છે જમુનાબાઈ; 
હરિભક્ત અતિ હેતવાન<RHYME_208222>, ધરે પ્રકટ પ્રભુનું ધ્યાન<RHYME_208222>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Jamunabai, a devotee of God, dedicates herself to His service; she constantly remembers and honors the Lord's presence.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેનું હેત જોઈને દયાળ<RHYME_208205>, નિત્યે જમે ભોજનનો થાળ<RHYME_208205>; 
સારાં પહેરી પીતાંબર શ્યામ<RHYME_208223>, દિયે દર્શન સુખના ધામ<RHYME_208223>.
gujarati.context: Having realized their true self, they take delight in their daily meals; wearing simple clothes like Shyam's (a humble ascetic), they behold the beauty of a peaceful life.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી ભૂત ભવિષ્યનું ભાખે, હોય થાવાનું તે કહી દાખે; 
થાય સાચું એ સર્વે જ જ્યારે, પામે આશ્ચર્ય સહુ જન ત્યારે.
gujarati.context: The couplet suggests that one should focus on the present moment, as the past is gone and the future is uncertain; only in the present does reality truly exist. It cautions against getting lost in nostalgia or worrying about what's to come.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ જમુનાબાઈને ઘેર<RHYME_208225>, આવે નિત્ય હરિ કરી મહેર<RHYME_208225>; 
એક સોનીબાઈ હરિજન<RHYME_208191>, નામ પારવતી તે પાવન<RHYME_208191>.
gujarati.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Surround yourself with people like Jamunabai, who always remember God's greatness; One such person is Sonibai, a devotee and servant of God.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જેને હેત અતિ હરિ માંઇ<RHYME_208193>, બીજે પ્રીત્ય નહિ જેને ક્યાંઈ; 
તેના ઘરમાં કુસંગ ઘણો, કરે દ્વેષ સહુ બાઈ તણો.
gujarati.context: Those who are dear to God have no rival elsewhere; in their homes, there is abundant hatred and love, equal and similar.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સતસંગમાં જાવા ન આપે, કહી વાંકાં વચન સંતાપે; 
સુણી સર્વે બોલે નહિ બાઈ, કરે ભજન બેઠી ઘર માંઇ<RHYME_208193>.
gujarati.context: In good company, one should not go, for words of wisdom are what cause sorrow; and everyone's home is a temple where they worship the divine.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તેની પ્રીત્યે તાણ્યા ભગવાન<RHYME_208192>, દિયે નિત્યે તે દર્શનદાન<RHYME_208192>; 
જમે થાળ દયાળ આવીને, દિયે પ્રસાદી સારી લાવીને.
gujarati.context: The devotee's love for God is like a constant stream of worship, and by doing so, they receive divine blessings daily. With pure intentions, they offer their hearts to the Lord, seeking His mercy and guidance.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કોઈ દિવસ એવો ન જાય<RHYME_208229>, જે નાવે નાથજી ઘર માંય<RHYME_208229>; 
એમ પાર્વતીબાઈને ઘેર<RHYME_208225>, નિત્ય કરે હરિ લીલાલેર<RHYME_208225>.
gujarati.context: There is no day that does not pass without having a roof over one's head; similarly, Parvati keeps Lord Krishna in her love and devotion daily.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એમ લાડ પાળે હરિજનનાં, કરે ગમતાં કાજ જનમનનાં; 
એમ પર્ચા આપે અવિનાશ, ધન્ય હરિજન હરિદાસ.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

The lowly Harigan (outcast) takes on noble deeds, earning good karma in their lifetime. God grants eternal bliss to such pious and grateful outcasts like Haridas.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી એક દિન આવ્યા હરિ, તેને જમાડ્યા ભજિયાં કરી; 
અતિ પ્રેમમાં ટેવ ન રહી, આપ્યાં ભજિયાં કાચેરાં લહી.
gujarati.context: One day, Lord Hari came to us and took upon Himself our devotion; He became so dear that even a small mistake felt like a heavy burden.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જમી પધાર્યા જગજીવન<RHYME_208232>, બાઈ મોંઘીબાઈને ભુવન<RHYME_208232>; 
કહે આજ પારવતી હાથ<RHYME_208202>, કાચાં ભજીયાં જમ્યા કહે નાથ<RHYME_208202>.
gujarati.context: Life's journey is a fleeting dream, and we are but humble pilgrims seeking divine bliss. Today's circumstances are uncertain, and tomorrow's path is unknown, yet we must walk on with faith.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવી વાત અલૌકિક જેહ<RHYME_208198>, જાણી જન મગન રહે તેહ<RHYME_208198>; 
સર્વે જાણો એ પ્રકટ પ્રમાણ<RHYME_208233>, રખે સ્વપ્ન સમજો સુજાણ<RHYME_208233>.
gujarati.context: A wonderful thing is beyond the ordinary that only a few people understand; know and grasp your own dream, with great wisdom.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
વળી એક તંબોળી તે માંઇ<RHYME_208193>, નામ તેનું છે જમુનાબાઈ; 
તેને ધારણા થાય હમેશ<RHYME_208234>, કરે પ્રભુ પાસે તે પ્રવેશ<RHYME_208234>.
gujarati.context: A humble person like Jamunabai has no pretenses, her name being synonymous with simplicity; she trusts in the Lord and enters His presence.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
સમાધિમાં કરે હરિસેવા, નિત્ય જમાડે મીઠાઈ મેવા; 
તેની વાત જાણી જન બીજે, સુણી પાપિયાં ન પરતિજે.
gujarati.context:
In the realm of the soul, one finds Lord Krishna, and every day tastes sweet; 

The world may know the truth, but foolish people do not accept it.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે એ વાત સર્વે છે ખોટી, મુખસ્વાદની કરો છો મોટી; 
જ્યારે નજરે દેખિયે અમે, ત્યારે માનિયે જે કહો તમે.
gujarati.context: This Gujarati couplet says that everything is a lie, except for one's personal desire; when you look at us, believe whatever you want to say.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કરો તમારે ઘેર ભોજન<RHYME_208192>, ભાણે બેસી જમે ભગવાન<RHYME_208192>; 
જે જે ભોજન ધરિયે થાળે, થાય ઓછું તેમાં તેહ કાળે.
gujarati.context: Prepare your plate with a simple meal, as if God has taken his seat; just as the food is consumed, so too will our time in this world.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
તે અમારી આંખ્યે જો દેખિયે, તો સહુ વારતા સાચી લેખિયે; 
એવું સુણી હરિજન બાઈ, કર્યો થાળ પોત્યે ઘર માંઇ<RHYME_208193>.
gujarati.context: If we gaze at our own hearts, then we will write a truthful letter; such is the wisdom of a Harinama Gauri, who has performed her duty in her own home.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
થયો સુંદર થાળ તૈયાર<RHYME_208241>, પ્રીત્યે જમિયા પ્રાણઆધાર<RHYME_208241>; 
જમી પધાર્યા જીવન જ્યારે, ફૂલહાર દેતા ગયા ત્યારે.
gujarati.context:
Here is a 1 to 2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet:

A beautiful arrangement has been made for love, with one's life as its foundation; when one attains their life's pinnacle, they bestow flowers (as offerings) on that occasion.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
જે જે ભોજને ભર્યો તો થાળ<RHYME_208205>, થયું અર્ધું જમિયા દયાળ<RHYME_208205>; 
દીઠો ફૂલનો પ્રકટ હાર<RHYME_208242>, જોઈ ચકિત થયાં નરનાર<RHYME_208242>.
gujarati.context: As one enjoys their fill of food, they should also be mindful of the portion left over; just like a flower's beauty is appreciated only when it's wilted.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
કહે આ વાત સરવે સાચી, જાણી સત્ય નથી કાંઈ કાચી; 
જોને હાર સારુ નરસઇ, કર્યા કાલાવાલા જને કંઈ.
gujarati.context: This couplet says that even if the truth is not evident, it's still important to know what's right and do good deeds; if you don't make a mistake, nothing will happen.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
એવા હજારો આપે છે હાર<RHYME_208242>, વાલો ભક્તને વારમવાર<RHYME_208242>; 
આજ વાવરે છે જે સામર્થિ, એવી કોઈ દિ વાવરી નથી.
gujarati.context: A thousand wars are fought by the proud and arrogant, but today's war is different as it has no equal in bravery.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

gujarati.couplet:
ધન્ય ધન્ય આજનો પ્રતાપ<RHYME_208244>, કવિ ક્રોડ્યે થાય નહિ થાપ<RHYME_208244>; 
વળી કરી છે જનની સાય<RHYME_208245>, તે નિષ્કુળાનંદે ન લખાય<RHYME_208245>.
gujarati.context: Today's pride is grateful gratitude, a poet's words are not crushed by criticism; the joy of the people has been created, and it will not be expressed in pure happiness.
gujarati.title_trans: Prakaran 148: Shrījī Mahārāje Harijanne Parachā Pūryā

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī vakhāṇu Vaḍodare, harijan mannu het; <RHYME_1>
Bhāve bhakti bhalī kare, sopī tan man dhan samet.  <RHYME_1>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of a simple person from Vadodara who is virtuous and has pure devotion to God. Their actions are good deeds that bring them spiritual wealth.

transliteration.couplet:
Joye na maḷe jaktamā, eh jevā jan ek; <RHYME_2>
Prītya jenī prakaṭ Prabhumā, grahī na mūke ṭek.  <RHYME_2>
transliteration.context: Joy comes to those who love and serve one thing alone; Only the devoted can reveal God's presence.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā jan anek chhe, jenā pūryā Harie lāḍ; <RHYME_3>
Tenī kīrti lakhavā, mārā chittamā ghaṇī chāḍ.  <RHYME_3>
transliteration.context: This couplet says that a person is like a jar filled with many things, and the Lord's name is the lid that holds it together. Without remembering God's name, one's mind becomes restless and agitated.

transliteration.couplet:
Brāhmaṇ nāgarī nātyamā, ek Monghībāī harijan; <RHYME_4>
Achaḷ-mati Mahārājmā, kare bhāve sahit bhajan.  <RHYME_4>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a Brahmin woman who has taken up dancing as her profession and is now performing with a Harijan (lower caste) musician, despite societal norms. The speaker praises the woman's courage to perform with someone from a lower social class.

transliteration.couplet:
Bhaje bhāve bharī Bhagwān, samaje Harine sāmarthivān; <RHYME_5>
Thāy samādhi dekhe Shrī Hari, ati sukhī rahe sukhe karī.  <RHYME_5>
transliteration.context: The couplet expresses the idea that one should worship God with a pure heart and surrender to Him. When doing so, one will experience great joy and remain peaceful in all situations.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek divase dhāraṇā māi, gaī hatā Hari potye tyāi; <RHYME_6>
Karyu darshan dayāḷu taṇu, teṇe āvyu chhe ānand ghaṇu.  <RHYME_6>
transliteration.context: In the eyes of God, even a cow's devotion is remarkable; for those who see Him with a compassionate heart, happiness is obtained effortlessly.

transliteration.couplet:
Pachhī Monghībāī kahe Mahārāj, tame Nāth chho rājādhirāj; <RHYME_7>
Sarve avatār tame ja dharyā, jugo-jugmā jan udhāryā.  <RHYME_7>
transliteration.context: The speaker is saying that the great Mahārāj has declared himself God (Nāth), and that all avatars (incarnations) reside within him, bearing witness to his grandeur from era to era.

transliteration.couplet:
Kevo līdho Kṛuṣhṇa avatār, kevā dhāryātā āyudh chār; <RHYME_8>
Vaḷī aṣhṭ paṭarāṇī jeh, jenā sut subhag chhe teh.  <RHYME_8>
transliteration.context: Lord Krishna's descent is like a shining sword, cutting through the darkness of ignorance. The union of Vaḷī and Aṣhṭ paṭarāṇī is blessed with good fortune and prosperity.

transliteration.couplet:
Eh sahit ichchhu darshan, diyo he Prabhu thaī prasanna; <RHYME_9>
Pachhī hasī bolyā Harirāy, joī jan-man abhiprāy.  <RHYME_9>
transliteration.context:
I desire a glimpse of You, Lord, and my prayer is fulfilled with Your pleased heart.
The laughter of Hariray has ended, my soul's longing is now at peace.

transliteration.couplet:
Dharyu Kṛuṣhṇarūp sukh-khāṇī, sange shobhe aṣhṭ paṭarāṇī; <RHYME_10>
Shankh chakra gadā padma dharī, shobhe sut sahit Shrīhari.  <RHYME_10>
transliteration.context:
Here is the summary:

The soul is filled with joy and delight in the form of Lord Krishna, and it shines brightly along with its companions; it is decorated with conch shell, wheel, mace, and lotus, accompanied by Sri Hari.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā dīdhā āvīne darshan, joī jan thayā chhe magan; <RHYME_11>
Daī darshan padhāryā Nāth, nīrkhī chakit thayo sau sāth.  <RHYME_11>
transliteration.context:
The summary is:

A glimpse of the divine is obtained when one's heart is pure and free from worldly attachments; the Lord reveals Himself to those who have detached themselves from material desires.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe āshcharya vāt ā to, thayo paracho kahyo nathī jāto; <RHYME_12>
Vaḷī ek bījī enī vāt, sahu sāmbhaḷajyo te sākṣhāt.  <RHYME_12>
transliteration.context:
The winds of surprise carry the one who has been separated from their loved ones; a single seed can become a tree with the support of the wind.

(The summary is just two lines as requested.)

transliteration.couplet:
Karyo Mahārājne kāje thāḷ, āvī jamiyā dīndayāḷ; <RHYME_13>
Jamyā penḍā patāsā ne pāk, vaḍā bhajiyā sundar shāk.  <RHYME_13>
transliteration.context: The great lord's tasks are done with ease, and the gathered people rejoice in delight. Just as a beautiful tree is adorned with lovely fruits, so too does one's life become sweet when worldly desires are renounced.

transliteration.couplet:
Jamī ardha vaḍu āpyu Nāthe, līdhu Monghībāe hātho-hāthe; <RHYME_14>
Āpī prasādī venchīne tenī, vaḷī vāt kahu bījī enī.  <RHYME_14>
transliteration.context: A person's life is half-owned by God and the other half by their own hands. Whatever one sows, they will reap accordingly.

transliteration.couplet:
Bīje divase Badrinā faḷ, jenā zīṇā bīj jāḍā daḷ; <RHYME_15>
Te āpyā chhe posh bharī potye, evā bījā maḷe nahi gotye.  <RHYME_15>
transliteration.context: The seed of a good character is sown in childhood, and it takes root with time. A person's behavior is shaped early on, and they will not suddenly change as adults.

transliteration.couplet:
Em parchā aparampār, āpe vālojī vāramvār; <RHYME_16>
Harijanmā moṭerā mukhī, ati alauki sukhmā sukhī.  <RHYME_16>
transliteration.context:
The couplet describes the simplicity and contentment of a Harijan (low-caste) woman's life, filled with peace and happiness.

Her face is radiant, her heart full of joy.

transliteration.couplet:
Tene gher bāio harijan, nitye suṇe kathā kīratan; <RHYME_17>
Bese sabhā bāionī manḍaḷī, kare vāt prakaṭnī vaḷī.  <RHYME_17>
transliteration.context: In the heart of a devotee, God's name is always heard and celebrated. With every moment, one's mind is filled with divine thoughts and actions become transparent to all.

transliteration.couplet:
Haiye prītya Hari māhi ghaṇī, shu kahīe moṭyap bāyo taṇī; <RHYME_18>
Tene ek divas mozār, thaī puṣhpanī vṛuṣhṭi apār.  <RHYME_18>
transliteration.context:
Here is a summary of the Gujarati couplet:

Love is like a fisherman who takes time to catch the sweetest moments; and sometimes, he gets nothing but waste water from his efforts.

Or in one line: Love is a patient hunter, taking time to reel in the sweetest moments, often ending with nothing.

transliteration.couplet:
Te satasangī kusangī maḷī, saue vīṇī līdhā teh vaḷī; <RHYME_19>
Em thayu din doy chār, ehādi nahi parchāno pār.  <RHYME_19>
transliteration.context: A true friend is one who shares both good and bad times equally, without hiding anything from you. With a true friend, even on the fourth day of celebration, you don't need to ask what's happening because they will share everything with you.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā parachā thāy anant, kahetā lakhatā na āve ant; <RHYME_20>
Vaḷī ek kahu bījī vāt, sāmarthi Shrīharinī sākṣhāt.  <RHYME_20>
transliteration.context:
The universe is endless and infinite, with no limits to its vastness; only the power of God can comprehend its magnitude.

A single seed can grow into a mighty tree with the help of wind and the strength of Goddess Shrīharinī.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek Ambābāī chhe dakṣhaṇī, kare bhakti Prabhujīnī ghaṇī; <RHYME_21>
Tenā dehno āviyo ant, āvyā teḍavā Shrī Bhagwant.  <RHYME_21>
transliteration.context: The devotee Ambabai is devoted to her Lord, singing His praise with utmost passion; she will soon leave this mortal coil and join the divine play of Sri Bhagwan.

transliteration.couplet:
Lāvyā vimān te lākho lekhe, chālyā teḍī jan sahu dekhe; <RHYME_22>
Satasangī kusangī sahune, thayā darshan jan bahune.  <RHYME_22>
transliteration.context: In the heavens, one hundred thousand gods are written down, and when you arrive, you see that same God; meanwhile on earth, a hundred thousand souls are gathered, but only a few get to experience divine vision.

transliteration.couplet:
Tyār pachhī eh Ambābāī, dīṭhā jane te samādhi māi; <RHYME_23>
Te sāthe em mokalyu kaī, ek endhāṇī sundar daī.  <RHYME_23>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a devotee's longing for God, Amba Bai, saying they can't bear to be separated from her even in death; their soul is beautiful and one with hers.

transliteration.couplet:
Shyām sāḍī paṭārāmā melī, te chhe bījī bāīne āpelī; <RHYME_24>
E vāt sarve sāchī jo thāy, to tame sanshe karasho mān kāy.  <RHYME_24>
transliteration.context: A seed is planted in the heart with love and care, hoping it will grow into a beautiful tree one day. Only true friends can truly understand and support each other's endeavors.

transliteration.couplet:
Te kahyu āvī samādhivāne, mānyu satya suṇī sarve kāne; <RHYME_25>
Je je vāt mokalītī kaī, te te sarave sāchī ja thaī.  <RHYME_25>
transliteration.context: When the heart is at peace and the mind is in harmony, one can truly hear the truth from everyone's lips. Similarly, when the breath of life is pure and unblemished, one can only utter the absolute truth.

transliteration.couplet:
Joī āshcharya pāmiyā jan, sahu kahevā lāgyā dhanya dhanya; <RHYME_26>
Vaḷī vāt anupam ek, kahu sāmarthi Harinī vishek.  <RHYME_26>
transliteration.context: One who experiences wonder is filled with gratitude and blessedness; the extraordinary wind of devotion is unmatched, only accessible to those with the strength of Harini.

transliteration.couplet:
Ek harijan dvij māi, tenu nām chhe Jamunābāī; <RHYME_27>
Haribhakta ati hetavān, dhare prakaṭ Prabhunu dhyān.  <RHYME_27>
transliteration.context: Jamunabai is a Harijan woman whose name means Lord's beloved, and she is deeply devoted to God. Her faith is so strong that it shines like a beacon, revealing the Lord's presence in her heart.

transliteration.couplet:
Tenu het joīne dayāḷ, nitye jame bhojanno thāḷ; <RHYME_28>
Sārā paherī pītāmbar Shyām, diye darshan sukhnā dhām.  <RHYME_28>
transliteration.context: The one who has mercy on you will always provide for your needs and give you comfort. May I have the blessing of Lord Shyam, who is easily pleased and grants peace to those who worship him.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī bhūt bhaviṣhyanu bhākhe, hoy thāvānu te kahī dākhe; <RHYME_29>
Thāya sāchu e sarve ja jyāre, pāme āshcharya sahu jan tyāre.  <RHYME_29>
transliteration.context: The future is uncertain, and the present moment is fleeting, making it hard to grasp; yet, some people's amazing luck helps them achieve success beyond their wildest dreams.

transliteration.couplet:
Em Jamunābāīne gher, āve nitya Hari karī maher; <RHYME_30>
Ek Sonībāī harijan, nām Pāravatī te pāvan.  <RHYME_30>
transliteration.context: A devotee's home is always filled with divine love, and God's presence is perpetual. The name "Pavani" (purifying) is fitting for Soni Bai, a virtuous woman.

transliteration.couplet:
Jene het ati Hari māi, bīje prītya nahi jene kyāī; <RHYME_31>
Tenā gharmā kusang ghaṇo, kare dveṣh sahu bāī taṇo.  <RHYME_31>
transliteration.context: The couplet speaks of someone who has been abandoned by fate and is now longing for love, but is uncertain if they will find it. They are left with only regrets and the pangs of longing, like a hot summer day that brings no relief from their pain.

transliteration.couplet:
Satasangmā jāvā na āpe, kahī vānkā vachan santāpe; <RHYME_32>
Suṇī sarve bole nahi bāī, kare bhajan beṭhī ghar māi.  <RHYME_32>
transliteration.context: The wise and learned do not seek to go anywhere else, but rather find inner peace through spiritual practice at home. Only the foolish and restless wander in search of meaning outside, while their true refuge lies within.

transliteration.couplet:
Tenī prītye tāṇyā Bhagwān, diye nitye te darshandān; <RHYME_33>
Jame thāḷ dayāḷ āvīne, diye prasādī sārī lāvīne.  <RHYME_33>
transliteration.context: In the Lord's presence, one constantly seeks divine vision; through compassion, one receives God's mercy and blessings.

transliteration.couplet:
Koī divas evo na jāy, je nāve Nāthjī ghar māy; <RHYME_34>
Em Pārvatībāīne gher, nitya kare Hari līlā-ler.  <RHYME_34>
transliteration.context: There is no perfect day that comes, when Lord Nāthjī doesn't reside at home; nor is there a moment without the divine play of Lord Hari at Pārvatībāī's place.

transliteration.couplet:
Em lāḍ pāḷe harijannā, kare gamatā kāj jan-mannā; <RHYME_35>
Em parchā āpe Avināsh, dhanya harijan haridās.  <RHYME_35>
transliteration.context: One's wealth is measured by the happiness of their family, and one's success is determined by their own inner peace. Eternal bliss is achieved through devotion to God, which brings prosperity and contentment.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī ek din āvyā Hari, tene jamāḍyā bhajiyā karī; <RHYME_36>
Ati premmā ṭev na rahī, āpyā bhajiyā kācherā lahī.  <RHYME_36>
transliteration.context: One day, God will take away my love, and I'll be left singing praises to Him; my heart won't remain with anyone else's love.

transliteration.couplet:
Jamī padhāryā Jagjīvan, bāī Monghībāīne bhuvan; <RHYME_37>
Kahe āj Pāravatī hāth, kāchā bhajīyā jamyā kahe Nāth.  <RHYME_37>
transliteration.context: The divine Lord Jagjivan has taken birth in the world of Monghibai; now He is holding Pāravati's hand and says "come" with Him.

transliteration.couplet:
Evī vāt alaukik jeh, jāṇī jan magan rahe teh; <RHYME_38>
Sarve jāṇo e prakaṭ pramāṇ, rakhe swapna samajo sujāṇ.  <RHYME_38>
transliteration.context: The couplet describes a divine and extraordinary love that remains in the world, allowing all to see its true form; it keeps us united just like a sweet dream.

transliteration.couplet:
Vaḷī ek tamboḷī te māi, nām tenu chhe Jamunābāī; <RHYME_39>
Tene dhāraṇā thāy hamesh, kare Prabhu pāse te pravesh.  <RHYME_39>
transliteration.context:
Here is a 1-2 line summarization of the Gujarati couplet in English:

The speaker's heart belongs to Jamunābāī; God has granted her entry into his world.

The constant longing for Jamunābāī will always be there, with God's permission.

transliteration.couplet:
Samādhimā kare Harisevā, nitya jamāḍe mīṭhāī mevā; <RHYME_40>
Tenī vāt jāṇī jan bīje, suṇī pāpiyā na paratije.  <RHYME_40>
transliteration.context: The devotees are absorbed in the thought of God and their worldly desires are reduced to mere sweetness; while others are busy sowing seeds of sin, unaware of their own faults.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe e vāt sarve chhe khoṭī, mukh-swādnī karo chho moṭī; <RHYME_41>
Jyāre najare dekhiye ame, tyāre māniye je kaho tame.  <RHYME_41>
transliteration.context: Everyone is foolish and deceived, but I'm being cautious with my words. See the one you're looking at, and believe what they say, for that's what they claim to be.

transliteration.couplet:
Karo tamāre gher bhojan, bhāṇe besī jame Bhagwān; <RHYME_42>
Je je bhojan dhariye thāḷe, thāy ochhu temā teh kāḷe.  <RHYME_42>
transliteration.context: Enjoy your meal at home and thank God for it.

transliteration.couplet:
Te amārī ānkhye jo dekhiye, to sahu vāratā sāchī lekhiye; <RHYME_43>
Evu suṇī harijan bāī, karyo thāḷ potye ghar māi.  <RHYME_43>
transliteration.context: When I look at my family's past, only the truth should be written down; This is the story of a Harijan couple, whose life was spent in poverty and struggle.

transliteration.couplet:
Thayo sundar thāḷ taiyār, prītye jamiyā prāṇ-ādhār; <RHYME_44>
Jamī padhāryā jīvan jyāre, fūlhār detā gayā tyāre.  <RHYME_44>
transliteration.context: The one prepared for love is supported by their very breath; in the game of life, the winner receives the reward.

transliteration.couplet:
Je je bhojane bharyo to thāḷ, thayu ardhu jamiyā dayāḷ; <RHYME_45>
Dīṭho fūlno prakaṭ hār, joī chakit thayā nar-nār.  <RHYME_45>
transliteration.context: A happy couple enjoys their meal together, sharing love and kindness. Their bond is strong like a blooming flower that grows with each passing day.

transliteration.couplet:
Kahe ā vāt sarave sāchī, jāṇī satya nathī kāī kāchī; <RHYME_46>
Jone hār sāru narasai, karyā kālāvālā jane kaī.  <RHYME_46>
transliteration.context: The truth is everywhere, one can find it anytime; One just needs to know the right time and place.

transliteration.couplet:
Evā hajāro āpe chhe hār, vālo bhaktane vāramvār; <RHYME_47>
Āj vāvare chhe je sāmarthi, evī koī di vāvarī nathī.  <RHYME_47>
transliteration.context: One's fate is already set, whether it be victory or defeat; whatever strength one has, there's no one who can give or take it away now.

transliteration.couplet:
Dhanya dhanya ājno pratāp, kavi kroḍye thāy nahi thāp; <RHYME_48>
Vaḷī karī chhe jannī sāy, te Niṣhkuḷānande na lakhāy.  <RHYME_48>
transliteration.context: The great deeds of today are celebrated with joy and praise, but the poet's words are not used as a measuring stick to judge others. The beauty of nature is appreciated, and one does not calculate its worth.
